1536<div class="Layout-module_omnimerse-column-sm-12__29AUW Layout-module_marginTopOnSmall__2rO47 merce-column">

1537<div class="">

1538<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-COLUMN-ddbd-dfd-b-e-dacdd">

1539<div class="merce-column-container">

1540<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-SEPARATOR-acc-cd-ccf--d">

1543</div>

1615</span>

1631<span id="prod-recs-row" class="identifier-plugin ">

1632<div class="styles-plugin-outer custom-outer-style-ROW-deddf-be-cb-ebb-effe">

1661<div class="Layout-module_omnimerse-column-sm-2__2dem_ Layout-module_marginTopOnSmall__2rO47 merce-column">

1662<div class="Layout-module_hidden-xs__2UQIp Layout-module_visible-sm__Z2eD8 Layout-module_visible-md__1t5sZ Layout-module_visible-lg__1PfV6 visibility-plugin-wrapper">

1663<div class="">

1664<span id="related-links-column" class="identifier-plugin ">

1668<div>

1673</span>

1674</div>

1675</div>

1676</div>

1677<div class="Layout-module_omnimerse-column-sm-10__EQSoU Layout-module_marginTopOnSmall__2rO47 merce-column">

1678<div class="">

1679<span id="seo-and-links-column" class="identifier-plugin ">

1680<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-COLUMN-baefb-ca-d-bf-cdaba">

1681<div class="merce-column-container">

1682<div class="Layout-module_visible-xs__2btQu Layout-module_hidden-sm__hU5SH Layout-module_hidden-md__2BSUe Layout-module_hidden-lg__1bFpH visibility-plugin-wrapper">

1683<span id="related-links-mobile" class="identifier-plugin ">

1684<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-CODE_BLOCK-ed-bf-ef-cee-dceffc">

1685<div>

1686</div>

1687</div>

1688</span>

1689</div>

1690<div class="styles-plugin-inner custom-inner-style-TEXTBLOCK-da-f--f-dfdb">

1691<div>

1692<div class=" TextBlock-module_textBlockContainer__X2cPA">

1693<div>

1694<h3>

1695Choosing the Perfect Sink for Your Laundry Room</h3>

1696

1697

1698<p>

1699Before the advent of washing machines and dryers, laundry sinks were necessary for handwashing clothes and linens using a washboard. Laundry sinks are currently used for many other reasons besides washing clothing, from pre-soaking clothing to get difficult stains out to washing pets to rinsing off muddy shoes.&nbsp;</p>

1700

1701

1702<p>

1703These are the types of laundry sinks to use for all the tasks you don&rsquo;t want to do in your kitchen sink:</p>

1704

1705

1706<ul>

1707

1708 <li>

1709Single-Basin&nbsp;</li>

1710

1711 <li>

1712Double-Basin&nbsp;</li>

1713

1714 <li>

1715Drop-In&nbsp;</li>

1716

1717 <li>

1718Undermount&nbsp;</li>

1719

1720 <li>

1721Wall-Mount&nbsp;</li>

1722

1723 <li>

1724Farmhouse</li>

1725

1726</ul>

1727

1728

1729<p>

1730Whether you&rsquo;re looking for a laundry, utility, or mudroom sink, the perfect sink for your home depends on your budget, space, and how you use it.&nbsp;</p>

1731

1732

1733<h3>

1734What is a Laundry Sink?</h3>

1735

1736

1737<p>

1738In the most basic definition, a laundry sink is any sink you put in your laundry room. However, it&rsquo;s often referred to as a utility sink, garage sink, basement sink, shop sink, slop sink, mud sink, tub sink, wash sink, or mudroom sink. Regardless of what it&rsquo;s called, most laundry sinks are no different from a large single-basin kitchen sink. In fact, many of these sinks are interchangeable, capable of being installed in both kitchen and laundry rooms.&nbsp;</p>

1739

1740

1741<p>

1742The most important factor for a laundry sink is size &ndash; the best sinks are wide and deep. That said, some laundry sinks are specifically made for laundry, mudrooms, or garages. These types have a very industrial look and are very utilitarian in design.</p>

1743

1744

1745<h3>

1746Types of Laundry Sinks</h3>

1747

1748

1749<p>

1750Just as with most utility tubs, there are many types of sinks. The best type of laundry tub sink for your home depends on your habits and preferences.&nbsp;</p>

1751

1752

1753<h4>

1754Single-Basin Laundry Sink</h4>

1755

1756

1757<p>

1758A <a href="https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-single-basin/">

1759<u>

1760single-basin laundry sink</u>

1761</a>

1762 is the most common type and simply has one large basin. Single-basin utility sinks are typically very large, between 24&rdquo; and 38&rdquo; wide, over 10&rdquo; deep, and almost always rectangular in shape. Single-Basin laundry sinks are available in any mounting style.</p>

1763

1764

1765<p>

1766Traditionally, single-basin laundry sinks were large enough to do a full load of laundry, which is why they are often 24&rdquo; deep in older homes. For handwashing however, the sink only needs to be large enough for a few articles of clothing. Many people use the laundry sink to wash pets or for holding mop water. In these cases, you want as deep a basin as possible to avoid splashing.</p>

1767

1768

1769<p>

1770Single-basin laundry sinks range between $100 and $500, depending on the size and material. Premium materials like stainless-steel laundry sinks and cast-iron sinks cost more while ceramic and thermoplastics are the most affordable.</p>

1771

1772

1773<h4>

1774Double-Basin Laundry Sink</h4>

1775

1776

1777<p>

1778<a href="https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-double-basin/">

1779<u>

1780Double-Basin laundry sinks</u>

1781</a>

1782 have two basins. They aren&rsquo;t common in laundry rooms because you only need one basin for most tasks. However, if you frequently handwash clothing, two basins are handy. You can soak whites in one bowl and colors in the other. For mopping, use one side for the soap and the other for rinsing.</p>

1783

1784

1785<p>

1786Most double-bowl laundry sinks have a 50/50 basin ratio, which means the bowls are the same size, with the basin split right down the middle. They also come in 60/40 or 40/60 splits and 70/30 or 30/70 splits. The bigger basin is often the same size as a standard single-basin, and the smaller basin usually has a shallower depth. &nbsp;</p>

1787

1788

1789<p>

1790Double-basin laundry tubs cost between $150 and $700. The main factors in prices are the size and material. If you want a large double-basin sink made from stainless steel, it&rsquo;s going to cost more than a plastic one.</p>

1791

1792

1793<h4>

1794Drop-In Laundry Sink</h4>

1795

1796

1797<p>

1798A <a href="https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-drop-in/">

1799<u>

1800drop-in laundry sink</u>

1801</a>

1802 fits into a cutout on a countertop, making it a favorite among the do-it-yourself crowd because it&rsquo;s easy to install. You simply drop it in and use plumber&rsquo;s putty and sealant to adhere it to the countertop. You need to make sure you choose a sink base cabinet with your vanity, so you have enough space for the sink and plumbing.</p>

1803

1804

1805<p>

1806The biggest issue with drop-in utility sinks is they make your countertop more difficult to clean. The lip or rim traps dirt and grime. However, since most laundry rooms have less counter space and fewer messes then a kitchen countertop, it might not be an issue for your home.</p>

1807

1808

1809<p>

1810The average drop-in utility sinks typically cost around $100. However, a high-quality stainless-steel sink, premium acrylic sink, or enameled cast-iron sink costs as high as $800.</p>

1811

1812

1813<h4>

1814Undermount Laundry Sink</h4>

1815

1816

1817<p>

1818<a href="https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-undermount/">

1819<u>

1820Undermount laundry sinks</u>

1821</a>

1822 mount to the underside of a countertop using clips and plumber&rsquo;s putty. The advantage of an undermount utility sink is it provides a seamless transition from the counter to the sink, which is ideal in the laundry room where wiping dirt from gardening clothes into the sink is useful. As with drop-in sinks, it requires a sink base cabinet.</p>

1823

1824

1825<p>

1826Some people prefer the sleek look of an undermount sink, but the installation process is more difficult than a drop-in laundry sink. It&rsquo;s not beyond the capabilities of an experienced DIYer, but we don&rsquo;t recommend it for a novice.</p>

1827

1828

1829<p>

1830Undermount utility sinks start at a similar price point to drop-in sinks, costing between $100 and $800 depending on the material and size. However, with the more complicated installation process, you likely end up spending more on an undermount, especially if you hire a professional to install it.</p>

1831

1832

1833<h4>

1834Wall-Mount Laundry Sink</h4>

1835

1836

1837<p>

1838<a href="https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-wall-mount/">

1839<u>

1840Wall-mounted laundry sinks</u>

1841</a>

1842 hearken back to the classic era of laundry sinks. These are typically mid-sized single-basin laundry sinks in a very utilitarian square or rectangular shape and have very deep basins. Many even include two front legs for added support. Wall-mount laundry sinks are great for laundry rooms with limited space. Since they don&rsquo;t need a cabinet, you can fit them in tighter areas. And you can still store cleaning materials below.</p>

1843

1844

1845<p>

1846The price point for wall-mount utility sinks is the widest, ranging between $50 and $1900. The more affordable models are made of a high-density thermoplastic while the high-end laundry sinks are made from enameled cast-iron. The latter, of course, lasts an exceptionally long time.</p>

1847

1848

1849<h4>

1850Farmhouse Laundry Sink</h4>

1851

1852

1853<p>

1854A <a href="https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-farmhouse/">

1855<u>

1856farmhouse laundry sink</u>

1857</a>

1858 is interpreted in several different ways &ndash; the freestanding utility sink, the sink-cabinet combination, and the standard apron-front farmhouse sink.</p>

1859

1860

1861<p>

1862The freestanding farmhouse laundry sink is a sink with four legs. Typically made of cast-iron or steel, this is a true farmhouse sink made for whatever chore was required. It was historically kept in a utility room, mudroom, or garage for cleaning large amounts of clothing, bathing children, washing pets, and cleaning tools and other household items. These freestanding utility sinks are very industrial looking. They aren&rsquo;t meant to be stylish or even evoke the &ldquo;farmhouse&rdquo; style, despite being very common on farms.</p>

1863

1864

1865<p>

1866The sink-cabinet combination is all about style. This is the sort of laundry sink you choose because you want your laundry room to have a farmhouse style. This type of farmhouse sink is usually also freestanding, because they don&rsquo;t attach to the wall, but the sink is mounted to a farmhouse style base cabinet (usually white with Shaker doors). These combos are plug-and-play &ndash; the entire component is pre-assembled and includes the cabinet, sink, and faucet. You just need to move it into place and connect plumbing.</p>

1867

1868

1869<p>

1870The standard apron-front farmhouse sink is no different from the same sinks used in a kitchen. Traditionally, these apron-front kitchen sinks were used for laundry as well as food prep and dishes. It&rsquo;s popular to install one in a laundry room as well as the kitchen.</p>

1871

1872

1873<p>

1874Farmhouse utility sinks start at around $150 and can cost over $2,000, depending on the size, type, and material. For example, an affordable freestanding farmhouse sink costs around $200 while a sink-cabinet combo usually starts around $700-$800. However, a high-end hand-hammered copper farmhouse sink costs well over $2,000.</p>

1875

1876

1877<h4>

1878Laundry Sink Parts &amp; Accessories</h4>

1879

1880

1881<p>

1882Since sinks don&rsquo;t usually come with drains, flanges, or strainers, check out our <a href="https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-parts-and-accessories/">

1883<u>

1884laundry sink parts and accessories</u>

1885</a>

1886 to complete your sink.&nbsp;</p>

1887

1888

1889<p>

1890Here are some accessories Vevano offers:</p>

1891

1892

1893<ul>

1894

1895 <li>

1896Sink Strainer: Keeps large items from going down the drain</li>

1897

1898 <li>

1899Workstations: A sink-top surface for holding or organizing items</li>

1900

1901 <li>

1902Storage Baskets: A wire compartment for storing sponges and soap</li>

1903

1904 <li>

1905Cap Flow: A sleek drain cap that allows water to drain, but keeps other items from dropping into the drain</li>

1906

1907 <li>

1908Air Gap: A system that allows water to drain smoothly and prevents backups</li>

1909

1910</ul>

1911

1912

1913<p>

1914Ready to pick out the perfect laundry sink? Get a <a href="https://vevano.com/page/design-services/">

1915<u>

1916virtual room design</u>

1917</a>

1918&nbsp;from our expert designers to see how your new sink looks in your space.</p>

1919

1920

1921<h3>

1922Choosing the Perfect Laundry Sink</h3>

1923

1924

1925<p>

1926According to expert testing at <a href="https://www.consumerreports.org/cro/sinks/buying-guide/index.htm" rel="nofollow">

1927<u>

1928ConsumerReports.org</u>

1929</a>

1930, the most important factor in choosing the best sink is material. The material determines how long the sink lasts, and how resistant it is to scratches, stains, chips, and cracks. However, before you focus on material, decide how you plan on using the sink, as this determines the type and size to look for.</p>

1931

1932

1933<h4>

1934Defining Function</h4>

1935

1936

1937<p>

1938The first decision in finding the best utility sink for your laundry room is to determine how you plan to use. Here are some things to consider:</p>

1939

1940

1941<ul>

1942

1943 <li>

1944<em>

1945Handwashing: </em>

1946Think about how much handwashing you do. You may want to look for a large sink if many of your clothes are handwash only.</li>

1947

1948 <li>

1949<em>

1950Pre-washing &amp; Stain Treatment: </em>

1951If you only plan to use the sink to soak delicate clothing or pre-treat stains, you probably don&rsquo;t need a large basin. A mid-size or even a small sink is big enough.</li>

1952

1953 <li>

1954<em>

1955Home Cleaning &amp; Mopping: </em>

1956If you have a lot of floors to mop, a utility sink is great for rinsing mops. Double-basin utility sinks can hold soap on one side and rinsing water on the other side.</li>

1957

1958 <li>

1959<em>

1960Cleaning Pets:</em>

1961 A large sink is great for giving dogs a good washing. Just make sure to include a sink strainer to collect as much hair and fur as possible so it doesn&rsquo;t clog the drain.</li>

1962

1963 <li>

1964<em>

1965Cleaning tools:</em>

1966 An industrial utility sink is often used to clean yard tools and other items. Usually, these sinks are installed in the garage.</li>

1967

1968</ul>

1969

1970

1971<h4>

1972<br />

1973

1974Determining Size</h4>

1975

1976

1977<p>

1978Laundry sinks range in size, from small enough to soak a few delicate items to large enough for a chihuahua to swim laps in. The size largely depends on how you plan to use it, but most laundry sinks have a depth of at least 10&rdquo;, and farmhouse sinks have depths over 24&rdquo;.</p>

1979

1980

1981<h4>

1982Choosing a Material</h4>

1983

1984

1985<p>

1986Material is the most important factor in the quality of a utility sink. It determines whether the sink lasts for 5 years of scrubbing or 50 years of scrubbing.&nbsp;</p>

1987

1988

1989<p>

1990<strong>

1991Enameled Cast Iron</strong>

1992<br />

1993

1994Cast-iron utility sinks are popular because they mimic the era when laundry sinks were common in most homes. They have an enameled glossy surface, typically in white. The coating gives the sink an exceptionally durable, scratch-resistant surface capable of handling the day-to-day scrubbing of hand washing linens. However, the enamel is prone to chipping if you drop heavy items into the sink. That said, while the enamel can chip, these utility sinks don&rsquo;t crack, so cast-iron sinks are among the most expensive, but they last a very long time.&nbsp;</p>

1995

1996

1997<p>

1998<strong>

1999Stainless Steel</strong>

2000<br />

2001

2002Stainless steel is popular for a variety of sinks because it&rsquo;s very durable, scratch-resistant, antimicrobial, and it looks great in modern and contemporary settings. It&rsquo;s also why a high grade stainless steel is used most often with commercial sinks and hand sinks.&nbsp;</p>

2003

2004

2005<p>

2006While it&rsquo;s a premium material, the ability to choose sinks in varying gauges makes some stainless-steel laundry sinks affordable. High gauges (which are thinner) for stainless-steel utility sinks are prone to denting. Therefore, the lower gauge sinks are more expensive, comparable to enameled cast-iron sinks. &nbsp;</p>

2007

2008

2009<p>

2010<strong>

2011Copper</strong>

2012<br />

2013

2014Copper is a premium material with a high price tag. Usually, they are reserved for the kitchen where the style and patina of a copper sink is on full display, but you can use a copper farmhouse laundry sink. Like stainless steel, choose a copper sink with a low gauge, so it isn&rsquo;t prone to denting.</p>

2015

2016

2017<p>

2018In addition to developing a patina that can increase the sinks&rsquo; value over time, copper is even more antimicrobial than stainless steel. This is a welcome feature if you want to avoid mildew developing after leaving clothing in the sink.</p>

2019

2020

2021<p>

2022<strong>

2023Fireclay &amp; Ceramic</strong>

2024<br />

2025

2026A ceramic laundry sink is made of clay that&rsquo;s fired at high temperatures with a glaze to harden the material. The glaze makes the surface exceptionally smooth, so it&rsquo;s scratch-resistant and stain-resistant. Fireclay laundry sinks include porcelain and vitreous china varieties.&nbsp;</p>

2027

2028

2029<p>

2030Ceramic laundry sinks look like enameled cast-iron sinks. However, they are typically more affordable because they are prone to cracking. Without a cast-iron core, a ceramic sink can crack all the way through, making it unrepairable.&nbsp;</p>

2031

2032

2033<p>

2034<strong>

2035Acrylic Plastic</strong>

2036<br />

2037

2038Acrylic, also known as solid surface, is a type of plastic often used for laundry sinks because it&rsquo;s easy to mold, durable, lightweight, and affordable. However, solid surface sinks don&rsquo;t have the lifespan of other materials and don&rsquo;t handle heat very well. They also scratch and stain easily.</p>

2039

2040

2041<h3>

2042Frequently Asked Questions About Laundry Sinks</h3>

2043

2044

2045<p>

2046<strong>

2047What size is a laundry sink?</strong>

2048<br />

2049

2050Laundry sinks vary in size. At the smallest, they are around 6&rdquo; deep and 20&rdquo; wide. The biggest laundry sinks are over 24&rdquo; deep and up 42&rdquo; wide. The size you choose depends on how you use it and how much room you have.</p>

2051

2052

2053<p>

2054<strong>

2055Do you really need a laundry sink?</strong>

2056<br />

2057

2058You don&rsquo;t need a laundry sink unless you handwash clothing frequently. In fact, many homes don&rsquo;t have laundry sinks, since most people use washing machines and dryers. Many design experts recommend forgoing the sink in your laundry room in favor of counterspace for folding laundry.&nbsp;</p>

2059

2060

2061<p>

2062<strong>

2063How do you clean your laundry sink?</strong>

2064<br />

2065

2066Fill the sink with warm water and a few capfuls of peroxide or ammonia. These chemicals kill any mildew causing bacteria. Then drain the sink, wash with soap, and rinse.&nbsp;</p>

2067

2068

2069<p>

2070<strong>

2071How much does it cost to install a laundry sink?</strong>

2072<br />

2073

2074If all you need to do is connect the plumbing, then you can easily install a laundry sink yourself. If you hire a professional, basic installations cost around $200, with the plumbing already set up and without complications. If the plumbing needs modifications, like for heavy duty pipes to drain dirt and mud, it can cost between $500 and $1,000. When you consider the cost of installing a utility sink faucet, add another $150 to $200 to the bill.</p>

2075

2076

2077<p>

2078<strong>

2079Can you wash your hands in a utility sink?</strong>

2080<br />

2081

2082Yes. Utility sinks are ideal for garages so you can wash grease and grime from cars, housework, and hobbies off your hands before you enter your house. Depending on where you install your utility sink, you may need a soap holder if your counter space doesn&rsquo;t have enough room to store a soap dispenser near your sink. Also consider adding a high-quality sink faucet for superior handwashing abilities.</p>

2083

2084

2085<p>

2086<strong>

2087What do you call a sink in the laundry room?</strong>

2088<br />

2089

2090Laundry sinks have several names &ndash; utility sink, utility tub, mud room sink, mud sink, vintage tub, mudroom sink, garage sinks, and more. Regardless of how they&rsquo;re named, they all generally have the same purpose &ndash; to clean things you wouldn&rsquo;t use a kitchen sink for.&nbsp;</p>

2091

2092

2093<p>

2094<strong>

2095What utility sink styles do you have to choose from?</strong>

2096<br />

2097

2098For laundry rooms, the laundry tubs typically come in traditional or modern styles to match a specific interior design. However, if you&rsquo;re getting a utility sink for your garage, it&rsquo;s typically a freestanding utility tub with a very basic industrial style &ndash; four legs supporting a rectangular tub with an industrial utility faucet.</p>

2099

2100

2101<h3>

2102Have Dirty Laundry? Get a Laundry Sink&nbsp;</h3>

2103

2104

2105<p>

2106Choosing the right laundry sink is all about finding the best material, the right size, and the best mounting style for your laundry room. Once you have your sink, you can turn your attention to other plumbing fixtures, like pull-out faucets and other plumbing supplies.</p>

2107

2108

2109<p>

2110At Vevano Home, we have a wide selection of the best utility sinks, from simple stainless-steel utility sinks to enameled cast-iron freestanding utility sinks. We can help you select the right sink for your home. Consult with our remote interior design experts by calling 855.483.2629 or email us your questions at <a href="mailto:design@vevano.com">

2111<u>

2112design@vevano.com</u>

2113</a>

2114.&nbsp;</p>

2115

2116</div>

2117</div>

2118</div>

2119</div>

d=\"M224,202.66A53.34,53.34,0,1,0,277.36,256,53.38,53.38,0,0,0,224,202.66Zm124.71-41a54,54,0,0,0-30.41-30.41c-21-8.29-71-6.43-94.3-6.43s-73.25-1.93-94.31,6.43a54,54,0,0,0-30.41,30.41c-8.28,21-6.43,71.05-6.43,94.33S91,329.26,99.32,350.33a54,54,0,0,0,30.41,30.41c21,8.29,71,6.43,94.31,6.43s73.24,1.93,94.3-6.43a54,54,0,0,0,30.41-30.41c8.35-21,6.43-71.05,6.43-94.33S357.1,182.74,348.75,161.67ZM224,338a82,82,0,1,1,82-82A81.9,81.9,0,0,1,224,338Zm85.38-148.3a19.14,19.14,0,1,1,19.13-19.14A19.1,19.1,0,0,1,309.42,189.74ZM400,32H48A48,48,0,0,0,0,80V432a48,48,0,0,0,48,48H400a48,48,0,0,0,48-48V80A48,48,0,0,0,400,32ZM382.88,322c-1.29,25.63-7.14,48.34-25.85,67s-41.4,24.63-67,25.85c-26.41,1.49-105.59,1.49-132,0-25.63-1.29-48.26-7.15-67-25.85s-24.63-41.42-25.85-67c-1.49-26.42-1.49-105.61,0-132,1.29-25.63,7.07-48.34,25.85-67s41.47-24.56,67-25.78c26.41-1.49,105.59-1.49,132,0,25.63,1.29,48.33,7.15,67,25.85s24.63,41.42,25.85,67.05C384.37,216.44,384.37,295.56,382.88,322Z\"\n /\u003e\n \u003c/svg\u003e\n \u003c/div\u003e\n \u003cp class=\"h4-regular\"\u003eShow Us Your \u003cspan\u003e#vevanoathome\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n \u003c/a\u003e\n (Default)"}],"customBackgroundColor":"#ffffff","textAlign":{"label":"None","value":"initial"},"border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","boxShadow":{"label":"None","value":"none"},"zIndex":"initial","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"","label":"Always Visible"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No LAUNDRY SINKS RELATED SEARCHES --\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"cat-tree-side\"\u003e\n \u003ch3 class=\"h3-black\"\u003eRelated Searches\u003c/h3\u003e\n \u003cul class=\"cat-tree-section\"\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eUtility Sinks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003ePull-Out Faucet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eStainless Steel Sink\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eLaundry Faucets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e","includeInHead":false,"elementId":"","additionalClasses":"","margins":"0px","padding":"0px","border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"","label":"Always Visible"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No animation"}}],"elementId":"related-links-column","additionalClasses":"","backgroundColor":[{"value":"transparent","label":"Transparent (Default)"}],"customBackgroundColor":"#ffffff","useBackgroundImage":{"value":false,"label":"No"},"backgroundImage":"","parallax":{"value":true,"label":"Yes"},"margins":"0px","padding":"0px","textAlign":{"label":"None","value":"initial"},"border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","boxShadow":{"label":"None","value":"none"},"visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"hidden-xs visible-sm visible-md visible-lg","label":"Desktop \u0026 Tablet Only"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No animation"}},{"id":"ba238efb-c3a6-4d00-b77f-4196cdab5a09","type":"COLUMN","children":[{"id":"e24d1978-b29f-4e5f-8cee-d9026cef0f0c","type":"CODE_BLOCK","children":[],"codeSnippet":"\u003c!-- LAUNDRY SINKS RELATED SEARCHES --\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"cat-tree-side\"\u003e\n \u003ch3 class=\"h3-black\"\u003eRelated Searches\u003c/h3\u003e\n \u003cul class=\"cat-tree-section\"\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eUtility Sinks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003ePull-Out Faucet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eStainless Steel Sink\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eLaundry Faucets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e","includeInHead":false,"elementId":"related-links-mobile","additionalClasses":"","margins":"24px 0 0 0","padding":"0px","border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"visible-xs hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg","label":"Mobile Only"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No animation"}},{"id":"d197832a-f585-4323-846f-58d82f8d2b01","type":"TEXTBLOCK","children":[],"richText":{"css":"","html":"\u003ch3\u003eChoosing the Perfect Sink for Your Laundry Room\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eBefore the advent of washing machines and dryers, laundry sinks were necessary for handwashing clothes and linens using a washboard. Laundry sinks are currently used for many other reasons besides washing clothing, from pre-soaking clothing to get difficult stains out to washing pets to rinsing off muddy shoes.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThese are the types of laundry sinks to use for all the tasks you don\u0026rsquo;t want to do in your kitchen sink:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eSingle-Basin\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eDouble-Basin\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eDrop-In\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eUndermount\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eWall-Mount\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eFarmhouse\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhether you\u0026rsquo;re looking for a laundry, utility, or mudroom sink, the perfect sink for your home depends on your budget, space, and how you use it.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eWhat is a Laundry Sink?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn the most basic definition, a laundry sink is any sink you put in your laundry room. However, it\u0026rsquo;s often referred to as a utility sink, garage sink, basement sink, shop sink, slop sink, mud sink, tub sink, wash sink, or mudroom sink. Regardless of what it\u0026rsquo;s called, most laundry sinks are no different from a large single-basin kitchen sink. In fact, many of these sinks are interchangeable, capable of being installed in both kitchen and laundry rooms.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe most important factor for a laundry sink is size \u0026ndash; the best sinks are wide and deep. That said, some laundry sinks are specifically made for laundry, mudrooms, or garages. These types have a very industrial look and are very utilitarian in design.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eTypes of Laundry Sinks\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eJust as with most utility tubs, there are many types of sinks. The best type of laundry tub sink for your home depends on your habits and preferences.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eSingle-Basin Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-single-basin/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003esingle-basin laundry sink\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e is the most common type and simply has one large basin. Single-basin utility sinks are typically very large, between 24\u0026rdquo; and 38\u0026rdquo; wide, over 10\u0026rdquo; deep, and almost always rectangular in shape. Single-Basin laundry sinks are available in any mounting style.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eTraditionally, single-basin laundry sinks were large enough to do a full load of laundry, which is why they are often 24\u0026rdquo; deep in older homes. For handwashing however, the sink only needs to be large enough for a few articles of clothing. Many people use the laundry sink to wash pets or for holding mop water. In these cases, you want as deep a basin as possible to avoid splashing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eSingle-basin laundry sinks range between $100 and $500, depending on the size and material. Premium materials like stainless-steel laundry sinks and cast-iron sinks cost more while ceramic and thermoplastics are the most affordable.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eDouble-Basin Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-double-basin/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003eDouble-Basin laundry sinks\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e have two basins. They aren\u0026rsquo;t common in laundry rooms because you only need one basin for most tasks. However, if you frequently handwash clothing, two basins are handy. You can soak whites in one bowl and colors in the other. For mopping, use one side for the soap and the other for rinsing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eMost double-bowl laundry sinks have a 50/50 basin ratio, which means the bowls are the same size, with the basin split right down the middle. They also come in 60/40 or 40/60 splits and 70/30 or 30/70 splits. The bigger basin is often the same size as a standard single-basin, and the smaller basin usually has a shallower depth. \u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eDouble-basin laundry tubs cost between $150 and $700. The main factors in prices are the size and material. If you want a large double-basin sink made from stainless steel, it\u0026rsquo;s going to cost more than a plastic one.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eDrop-In Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-drop-in/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003edrop-in laundry sink\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e fits into a cutout on a countertop, making it a favorite among the do-it-yourself crowd because it\u0026rsquo;s easy to install. You simply drop it in and use plumber\u0026rsquo;s putty and sealant to adhere it to the countertop. You need to make sure you choose a sink base cabinet with your vanity, so you have enough space for the sink and plumbing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe biggest issue with drop-in utility sinks is they make your countertop more difficult to clean. The lip or rim traps dirt and grime. However, since most laundry rooms have less counter space and fewer messes then a kitchen countertop, it might not be an issue for your home.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe average drop-in utility sinks typically cost around $100. However, a high-quality stainless-steel sink, premium acrylic sink, or enameled cast-iron sink costs as high as $800.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eUndermount Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-undermount/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003eUndermount laundry sinks\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e mount to the underside of a countertop using clips and plumber\u0026rsquo;s putty. The advantage of an undermount utility sink is it provides a seamless transition from the counter to the sink, which is ideal in the laundry room where wiping dirt from gardening clothes into the sink is useful. As with drop-in sinks, it requires a sink base cabinet.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eSome people prefer the sleek look of an undermount sink, but the installation process is more difficult than a drop-in laundry sink. It\u0026rsquo;s not beyond the capabilities of an experienced DIYer, but we don\u0026rsquo;t recommend it for a novice.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eUndermount utility sinks start at a similar price point to drop-in sinks, costing between $100 and $800 depending on the material and size. However, with the more complicated installation process, you likely end up spending more on an undermount, especially if you hire a professional to install it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eWall-Mount Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-wall-mount/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003eWall-mounted laundry sinks\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e hearken back to the classic era of laundry sinks. These are typically mid-sized single-basin laundry sinks in a very utilitarian square or rectangular shape and have very deep basins. Many even include two front legs for added support. Wall-mount laundry sinks are great for laundry rooms with limited space. Since they don\u0026rsquo;t need a cabinet, you can fit them in tighter areas. And you can still store cleaning materials below.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe price point for wall-mount utility sinks is the widest, ranging between $50 and $1900. The more affordable models are made of a high-density thermoplastic while the high-end laundry sinks are made from enameled cast-iron. The latter, of course, lasts an exceptionally long time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eFarmhouse Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-farmhouse/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003efarmhouse laundry sink\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e is interpreted in several different ways \u0026ndash; the freestanding utility sink, the sink-cabinet combination, and the standard apron-front farmhouse sink.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe freestanding farmhouse laundry sink is a sink with four legs. Typically made of cast-iron or steel, this is a true farmhouse sink made for whatever chore was required. It was historically kept in a utility room, mudroom, or garage for cleaning large amounts of clothing, bathing children, washing pets, and cleaning tools and other household items. These freestanding utility sinks are very industrial looking. They aren\u0026rsquo;t meant to be stylish or even evoke the \u0026ldquo;farmhouse\u0026rdquo; style, despite being very common on farms.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe sink-cabinet combination is all about style. This is the sort of laundry sink you choose because you want your laundry room to have a farmhouse style. This type of farmhouse sink is usually also freestanding, because they don\u0026rsquo;t attach to the wall, but the sink is mounted to a farmhouse style base cabinet (usually white with Shaker doors). These combos are plug-and-play \u0026ndash; the entire component is pre-assembled and includes the cabinet, sink, and faucet. You just need to move it into place and connect plumbing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe standard apron-front farmhouse sink is no different from the same sinks used in a kitchen. Traditionally, these apron-front kitchen sinks were used for laundry as well as food prep and dishes. It\u0026rsquo;s popular to install one in a laundry room as well as the kitchen.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eFarmhouse utility sinks start at around $150 and can cost over $2,000, depending on the size, type, and material. For example, an affordable freestanding farmhouse sink costs around $200 while a sink-cabinet combo usually starts around $700-$800. However, a high-end hand-hammered copper farmhouse sink costs well over $2,000.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eLaundry Sink Parts \u0026amp; Accessories\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eSince sinks don\u0026rsquo;t usually come with drains, flanges, or strainers, check out our \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-parts-and-accessories/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003elaundry sink parts and accessories\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to complete your sink.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eHere are some accessories Vevano offers:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eSink Strainer: Keeps large items from going down the drain\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eWorkstations: A sink-top surface for holding or organizing items\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eStorage Baskets: A wire compartment for storing sponges and soap\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eCap Flow: A sleek drain cap that allows water to drain, but keeps other items from dropping into the drain\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eAir Gap: A system that allows water to drain smoothly and prevents backups\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eReady to pick out the perfect laundry sink? Get a \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/page/design-services/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003evirtual room design\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;from our expert designers to see how your new sink looks in your space.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eChoosing the Perfect Laundry Sink\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to expert testing at \u003ca href=\"https://www.consumerreports.org/cro/sinks/buying-guide/index.htm\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cu\u003eConsumerReports.org\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the most important factor in choosing the best sink is material. The material determines how long the sink lasts, and how resistant it is to scratches, stains, chips, and cracks. However, before you focus on material, decide how you plan on using the sink, as this determines the type and size to look for.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eDefining Function\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe first decision in finding the best utility sink for your laundry room is to determine how you plan to use. Here are some things to consider:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eHandwashing: \u003c/em\u003eThink about how much handwashing you do. You may want to look for a large sink if many of your clothes are handwash only.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003ePre-washing \u0026amp; Stain Treatment: \u003c/em\u003eIf you only plan to use the sink to soak delicate clothing or pre-treat stains, you probably don\u0026rsquo;t need a large basin. A mid-size or even a small sink is big enough.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eHome Cleaning \u0026amp; Mopping: \u003c/em\u003eIf you have a lot of floors to mop, a utility sink is great for rinsing mops. Double-basin utility sinks can hold soap on one side and rinsing water on the other side.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eCleaning Pets:\u003c/em\u003e A large sink is great for giving dogs a good washing. Just make sure to include a sink strainer to collect as much hair and fur as possible so it doesn\u0026rsquo;t clog the drain.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eCleaning tools:\u003c/em\u003e An industrial utility sink is often used to clean yard tools and other items. Usually, these sinks are installed in the garage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nDetermining Size\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eLaundry sinks range in size, from small enough to soak a few delicate items to large enough for a chihuahua to swim laps in. The size largely depends on how you plan to use it, but most laundry sinks have a depth of at least 10\u0026rdquo;, and farmhouse sinks have depths over 24\u0026rdquo;.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eChoosing a Material\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eMaterial is the most important factor in the quality of a utility sink. It determines whether the sink lasts for 5 years of scrubbing or 50 years of scrubbing.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEnameled Cast Iron\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nCast-iron utility sinks are popular because they mimic the era when laundry sinks were common in most homes. They have an enameled glossy surface, typically in white. The coating gives the sink an exceptionally durable, scratch-resistant surface capable of handling the day-to-day scrubbing of hand washing linens. However, the enamel is prone to chipping if you drop heavy items into the sink. That said, while the enamel can chip, these utility sinks don\u0026rsquo;t crack, so cast-iron sinks are among the most expensive, but they last a very long time.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStainless Steel\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nStainless steel is popular for a variety of sinks because it\u0026rsquo;s very durable, scratch-resistant, antimicrobial, and it looks great in modern and contemporary settings. It\u0026rsquo;s also why a high grade stainless steel is used most often with commercial sinks and hand sinks.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile it\u0026rsquo;s a premium material, the ability to choose sinks in varying gauges makes some stainless-steel laundry sinks affordable. High gauges (which are thinner) for stainless-steel utility sinks are prone to denting. Therefore, the lower gauge sinks are more expensive, comparable to enameled cast-iron sinks. \u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCopper\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nCopper is a premium material with a high price tag. Usually, they are reserved for the kitchen where the style and patina of a copper sink is on full display, but you can use a copper farmhouse laundry sink. Like stainless steel, choose a copper sink with a low gauge, so it isn\u0026rsquo;t prone to denting.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn addition to developing a patina that can increase the sinks\u0026rsquo; value over time, copper is even more antimicrobial than stainless steel. This is a welcome feature if you want to avoid mildew developing after leaving clothing in the sink.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFireclay \u0026amp; Ceramic\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nA ceramic laundry sink is made of clay that\u0026rsquo;s fired at high temperatures with a glaze to harden the material. The glaze makes the surface exceptionally smooth, so it\u0026rsquo;s scratch-resistant and stain-resistant. Fireclay laundry sinks include porcelain and vitreous china varieties.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eCeramic laundry sinks look like enameled cast-iron sinks. However, they are typically more affordable because they are prone to cracking. Without a cast-iron core, a ceramic sink can crack all the way through, making it unrepairable.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAcrylic Plastic\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nAcrylic, also known as solid surface, is a type of plastic often used for laundry sinks because it\u0026rsquo;s easy to mold, durable, lightweight, and affordable. However, solid surface sinks don\u0026rsquo;t have the lifespan of other materials and don\u0026rsquo;t handle heat very well. They also scratch and stain easily.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eFrequently Asked Questions About Laundry Sinks\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat size is a laundry sink?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nLaundry sinks vary in size. At the smallest, they are around 6\u0026rdquo; deep and 20\u0026rdquo; wide. The biggest laundry sinks are over 24\u0026rdquo; deep and up 42\u0026rdquo; wide. The size you choose depends on how you use it and how much room you have.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDo you really need a laundry sink?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nYou don\u0026rsquo;t need a laundry sink unless you handwash clothing frequently. In fact, many homes don\u0026rsquo;t have laundry sinks, since most people use washing machines and dryers. Many design experts recommend forgoing the sink in your laundry room in favor of counterspace for folding laundry.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow do you clean your laundry sink?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nFill the sink with warm water and a few capfuls of peroxide or ammonia. These chemicals kill any mildew causing bacteria. Then drain the sink, wash with soap, and rinse.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow much does it cost to install a laundry sink?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nIf all you need to do is connect the plumbing, then you can easily install a laundry sink yourself. If you hire a professional, basic installations cost around $200, with the plumbing already set up and without complications. If the plumbing needs modifications, like for heavy duty pipes to drain dirt and mud, it can cost between $500 and $1,000. When you consider the cost of installing a utility sink faucet, add another $150 to $200 to the bill.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCan you wash your hands in a utility sink?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nYes. Utility sinks are ideal for garages so you can wash grease and grime from cars, housework, and hobbies off your hands before you enter your house. Depending on where you install your utility sink, you may need a soap holder if your counter space doesn\u0026rsquo;t have enough room to store a soap dispenser near your sink. Also consider adding a high-quality sink faucet for superior handwashing abilities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat do you call a sink in the laundry room?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nLaundry sinks have several names \u0026ndash; utility sink, utility tub, mud room sink, mud sink, vintage tub, mudroom sink, garage sinks, and more. Regardless of how they\u0026rsquo;re named, they all generally have the same purpose \u0026ndash; to clean things you wouldn\u0026rsquo;t use a kitchen sink for.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat utility sink styles do you have to choose from?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nFor laundry rooms, the laundry tubs typically come in traditional or modern styles to match a specific interior design. However, if you\u0026rsquo;re getting a utility sink for your garage, it\u0026rsquo;s typically a freestanding utility tub with a very basic industrial style \u0026ndash; four legs supporting a rectangular tub with an industrial utility faucet.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eHave Dirty Laundry? Get a Laundry Sink\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eChoosing the right laundry sink is all about finding the best material, the right size, and the best mounting style for your laundry room. Once you have your sink, you can turn your attention to other plumbing fixtures, like pull-out faucets and other plumbing supplies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAt Vevano Home, we have a wide selection of the best utility sinks, from simple stainless-steel utility sinks to enameled cast-iron freestanding utility sinks. We can help you select the right sink for your home. Rotation"},"flipVertical":{"value":false,"label":"No"},"flipHorizontally":{"value":false,"label":"No"},"elementId":"prod-recs-row","additionalClasses":"","backgroundColor":[{"value":"transparent","label":"Transparent (Default)"}],"customBackgroundColor":"#ffffff","textAlign":{"label":"None","value":"initial"},"border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","boxShadow":{"label":"None","value":"none"},"zIndex":"initial","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"","label":"Always Visible"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No animation"},"publishToday":{"value":true,"label":"Yes"},"startDate":"2021-02-25T22:41:28.358Z","endDate":"2021-02-25T22:41:28.358Z"},"f56a1fd1-84ab-4cde-96c0-123a777bdcc1":{"id":"f56a1fd1-84ab-4cde-96c0-123a777bdcc1","type":"ROW","children":[{"id":"2b4a9a84-0d55-4c6e-a21f-afab56497467","type":"COLUMN","children":[{"id":"cd4467d4-d9a7-4f53-a598-f74ded125825","type":"CODE_BLOCK","children":[],"codeSnippet":"\u003c!-- LAUNDRY SINKS RELATED SEARCHES --\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"cat-tree-side\"\u003e\n \u003ch3 class=\"h3-black\"\u003eRelated Searches\u003c/h3\u003e\n \u003cul class=\"cat-tree-section\"\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eUtility Sinks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003ePull-Out Faucet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eStainless Steel Sink\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eLaundry Faucets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e","includeInHead":false,"elementId":"","additionalClasses":"","margins":"0px","padding":"0px","border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"","label":"Always Visible"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No animation"}}],"elementId":"related-links-column","additionalClasses":"","backgroundColor":[{"value":"transparent","label":"Transparent (Default)"}],"customBackgroundColor":"#ffffff","useBackgroundImage":{"value":false,"label":"No"},"backgroundImage":"","parallax":{"value":true,"label":"Yes"},"margins":"0px","padding":"0px","textAlign":{"label":"None","value":"initial"},"border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","boxShadow":{"label":"None","value":"none"},"visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"hidden-xs visible-sm visible-md visible-lg","label":"Desktop \u0026 Tablet Only"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No animation"}},{"id":"ba238efb-c3a6-4d00-b77f-4196cdab5a09","type":"COLUMN","children":[{"id":"e24d1978-b29f-4e5f-8cee-d9026cef0f0c","type":"CODE_BLOCK","children":[],"codeSnippet":"\u003c!-- LAUNDRY SINKS RELATED SEARCHES --\u003e\n\n\u003cdiv class=\"cat-tree-side\"\u003e\n \u003ch3 class=\"h3-black\"\u003eRelated Searches\u003c/h3\u003e\n \u003cul class=\"cat-tree-section\"\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eUtility Sinks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003ePull-Out Faucet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eStainless Steel Sink\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"\" class=\"body-regular related-search\"\u003eLaundry Faucets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n \u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e","includeInHead":false,"elementId":"related-links-mobile","additionalClasses":"","margins":"24px 0 0 0","padding":"0px","border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"visible-xs hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg","label":"Mobile Only"},"targetAnimation":{"value":"","label":"No animation"}},{"id":"d197832a-f585-4323-846f-58d82f8d2b01","type":"TEXTBLOCK","children":[],"richText":{"css":"","html":"\u003ch3\u003eChoosing the Perfect Sink for Your Laundry Room\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eBefore the advent of washing machines and dryers, laundry sinks were necessary for handwashing clothes and linens using a washboard. Laundry sinks are currently used for many other reasons besides washing clothing, from pre-soaking clothing to get difficult stains out to washing pets to rinsing off muddy shoes.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThese are the types of laundry sinks to use for all the tasks you don\u0026rsquo;t want to do in your kitchen sink:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eSingle-Basin\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eDouble-Basin\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eDrop-In\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eUndermount\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eWall-Mount\u0026nbsp;\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eFarmhouse\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhether you\u0026rsquo;re looking for a laundry, utility, or mudroom sink, the perfect sink for your home depends on your budget, space, and how you use it.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eWhat is a Laundry Sink?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn the most basic definition, a laundry sink is any sink you put in your laundry room. However, it\u0026rsquo;s often referred to as a utility sink, garage sink, basement sink, shop sink, slop sink, mud sink, tub sink, wash sink, or mudroom sink. Regardless of what it\u0026rsquo;s called, most laundry sinks are no different from a large single-basin kitchen sink. In fact, many of these sinks are interchangeable, capable of being installed in both kitchen and laundry rooms.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe most important factor for a laundry sink is size \u0026ndash; the best sinks are wide and deep. That said, some laundry sinks are specifically made for laundry, mudrooms, or garages. These types have a very industrial look and are very utilitarian in design.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eTypes of Laundry Sinks\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eJust as with most utility tubs, there are many types of sinks. The best type of laundry tub sink for your home depends on your habits and preferences.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eSingle-Basin Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-single-basin/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003esingle-basin laundry sink\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e is the most common type and simply has one large basin. Single-basin utility sinks are typically very large, between 24\u0026rdquo; and 38\u0026rdquo; wide, over 10\u0026rdquo; deep, and almost always rectangular in shape. Single-Basin laundry sinks are available in any mounting style.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eTraditionally, single-basin laundry sinks were large enough to do a full load of laundry, which is why they are often 24\u0026rdquo; deep in older homes. For handwashing however, the sink only needs to be large enough for a few articles of clothing. Many people use the laundry sink to wash pets or for holding mop water. In these cases, you want as deep a basin as possible to avoid splashing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eSingle-basin laundry sinks range between $100 and $500, depending on the size and material. Premium materials like stainless-steel laundry sinks and cast-iron sinks cost more while ceramic and thermoplastics are the most affordable.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eDouble-Basin Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-double-basin/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003eDouble-Basin laundry sinks\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e have two basins. They aren\u0026rsquo;t common in laundry rooms because you only need one basin for most tasks. However, if you frequently handwash clothing, two basins are handy. You can soak whites in one bowl and colors in the other. For mopping, use one side for the soap and the other for rinsing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eMost double-bowl laundry sinks have a 50/50 basin ratio, which means the bowls are the same size, with the basin split right down the middle. They also come in 60/40 or 40/60 splits and 70/30 or 30/70 splits. The bigger basin is often the same size as a standard single-basin, and the smaller basin usually has a shallower depth. \u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eDouble-basin laundry tubs cost between $150 and $700. The main factors in prices are the size and material. If you want a large double-basin sink made from stainless steel, it\u0026rsquo;s going to cost more than a plastic one.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eDrop-In Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-drop-in/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003edrop-in laundry sink\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e fits into a cutout on a countertop, making it a favorite among the do-it-yourself crowd because it\u0026rsquo;s easy to install. You simply drop it in and use plumber\u0026rsquo;s putty and sealant to adhere it to the countertop. You need to make sure you choose a sink base cabinet with your vanity, so you have enough space for the sink and plumbing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe biggest issue with drop-in utility sinks is they make your countertop more difficult to clean. The lip or rim traps dirt and grime. However, since most laundry rooms have less counter space and fewer messes then a kitchen countertop, it might not be an issue for your home.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe average drop-in utility sinks typically cost around $100. However, a high-quality stainless-steel sink, premium acrylic sink, or enameled cast-iron sink costs as high as $800.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eUndermount Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-undermount/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003eUndermount laundry sinks\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e mount to the underside of a countertop using clips and plumber\u0026rsquo;s putty. The advantage of an undermount utility sink is it provides a seamless transition from the counter to the sink, which is ideal in the laundry room where wiping dirt from gardening clothes into the sink is useful. As with drop-in sinks, it requires a sink base cabinet.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eSome people prefer the sleek look of an undermount sink, but the installation process is more difficult than a drop-in laundry sink. It\u0026rsquo;s not beyond the capabilities of an experienced DIYer, but we don\u0026rsquo;t recommend it for a novice.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eUndermount utility sinks start at a similar price point to drop-in sinks, costing between $100 and $800 depending on the material and size. However, with the more complicated installation process, you likely end up spending more on an undermount, especially if you hire a professional to install it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eWall-Mount Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-wall-mount/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003eWall-mounted laundry sinks\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e hearken back to the classic era of laundry sinks. These are typically mid-sized single-basin laundry sinks in a very utilitarian square or rectangular shape and have very deep basins. Many even include two front legs for added support. Wall-mount laundry sinks are great for laundry rooms with limited space. Since they don\u0026rsquo;t need a cabinet, you can fit them in tighter areas. And you can still store cleaning materials below.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe price point for wall-mount utility sinks is the widest, ranging between $50 and $1900. The more affordable models are made of a high-density thermoplastic while the high-end laundry sinks are made from enameled cast-iron. The latter, of course, lasts an exceptionally long time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eFarmhouse Laundry Sink\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-farmhouse/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003efarmhouse laundry sink\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e is interpreted in several different ways \u0026ndash; the freestanding utility sink, the sink-cabinet combination, and the standard apron-front farmhouse sink.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe freestanding farmhouse laundry sink is a sink with four legs. Typically made of cast-iron or steel, this is a true farmhouse sink made for whatever chore was required. It was historically kept in a utility room, mudroom, or garage for cleaning large amounts of clothing, bathing children, washing pets, and cleaning tools and other household items. These freestanding utility sinks are very industrial looking. They aren\u0026rsquo;t meant to be stylish or even evoke the \u0026ldquo;farmhouse\u0026rdquo; style, despite being very common on farms.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe sink-cabinet combination is all about style. This is the sort of laundry sink you choose because you want your laundry room to have a farmhouse style. This type of farmhouse sink is usually also freestanding, because they don\u0026rsquo;t attach to the wall, but the sink is mounted to a farmhouse style base cabinet (usually white with Shaker doors). These combos are plug-and-play \u0026ndash; the entire component is pre-assembled and includes the cabinet, sink, and faucet. You just need to move it into place and connect plumbing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe standard apron-front farmhouse sink is no different from the same sinks used in a kitchen. Traditionally, these apron-front kitchen sinks were used for laundry as well as food prep and dishes. It\u0026rsquo;s popular to install one in a laundry room as well as the kitchen.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eFarmhouse utility sinks start at around $150 and can cost over $2,000, depending on the size, type, and material. For example, an affordable freestanding farmhouse sink costs around $200 while a sink-cabinet combo usually starts around $700-$800. However, a high-end hand-hammered copper farmhouse sink costs well over $2,000.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eLaundry Sink Parts \u0026amp; Accessories\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eSince sinks don\u0026rsquo;t usually come with drains, flanges, or strainers, check out our \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/catalog/sinks-laundry-parts-and-accessories/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003elaundry sink parts and accessories\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e to complete your sink.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eHere are some accessories Vevano offers:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eSink Strainer: Keeps large items from going down the drain\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eWorkstations: A sink-top surface for holding or organizing items\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eStorage Baskets: A wire compartment for storing sponges and soap\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eCap Flow: A sleek drain cap that allows water to drain, but keeps other items from dropping into the drain\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003eAir Gap: A system that allows water to drain smoothly and prevents backups\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eReady to pick out the perfect laundry sink? Get a \u003ca href=\"https://vevano.com/page/design-services/\"\u003e\u003cu\u003evirtual room design\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u0026nbsp;from our expert designers to see how your new sink looks in your space.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eChoosing the Perfect Laundry Sink\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAccording to expert testing at \u003ca href=\"https://www.consumerreports.org/cro/sinks/buying-guide/index.htm\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003e\u003cu\u003eConsumerReports.org\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, the most important factor in choosing the best sink is material. The material determines how long the sink lasts, and how resistant it is to scratches, stains, chips, and cracks. However, before you focus on material, decide how you plan on using the sink, as this determines the type and size to look for.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eDefining Function\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eThe first decision in finding the best utility sink for your laundry room is to determine how you plan to use. Here are some things to consider:\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cul\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eHandwashing: \u003c/em\u003eThink about how much handwashing you do. You may want to look for a large sink if many of your clothes are handwash only.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003ePre-washing \u0026amp; Stain Treatment: \u003c/em\u003eIf you only plan to use the sink to soak delicate clothing or pre-treat stains, you probably don\u0026rsquo;t need a large basin. A mid-size or even a small sink is big enough.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eHome Cleaning \u0026amp; Mopping: \u003c/em\u003eIf you have a lot of floors to mop, a utility sink is great for rinsing mops. Double-basin utility sinks can hold soap on one side and rinsing water on the other side.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eCleaning Pets:\u003c/em\u003e A large sink is great for giving dogs a good washing. Just make sure to include a sink strainer to collect as much hair and fur as possible so it doesn\u0026rsquo;t clog the drain.\u003c/li\u003e\n\t\u003cli\u003e\u003cem\u003eCleaning tools:\u003c/em\u003e An industrial utility sink is often used to clean yard tools and other items. Usually, these sinks are installed in the garage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nDetermining Size\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eLaundry sinks range in size, from small enough to soak a few delicate items to large enough for a chihuahua to swim laps in. The size largely depends on how you plan to use it, but most laundry sinks have a depth of at least 10\u0026rdquo;, and farmhouse sinks have depths over 24\u0026rdquo;.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch4\u003eChoosing a Material\u003c/h4\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eMaterial is the most important factor in the quality of a utility sink. It determines whether the sink lasts for 5 years of scrubbing or 50 years of scrubbing.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEnameled Cast Iron\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nCast-iron utility sinks are popular because they mimic the era when laundry sinks were common in most homes. They have an enameled glossy surface, typically in white. The coating gives the sink an exceptionally durable, scratch-resistant surface capable of handling the day-to-day scrubbing of hand washing linens. However, the enamel is prone to chipping if you drop heavy items into the sink. That said, while the enamel can chip, these utility sinks don\u0026rsquo;t crack, so cast-iron sinks are among the most expensive, but they last a very long time.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStainless Steel\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nStainless steel is popular for a variety of sinks because it\u0026rsquo;s very durable, scratch-resistant, antimicrobial, and it looks great in modern and contemporary settings. It\u0026rsquo;s also why a high grade stainless steel is used most often with commercial sinks and hand sinks.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eWhile it\u0026rsquo;s a premium material, the ability to choose sinks in varying gauges makes some stainless-steel laundry sinks affordable. High gauges (which are thinner) for stainless-steel utility sinks are prone to denting. Therefore, the lower gauge sinks are more expensive, comparable to enameled cast-iron sinks. \u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCopper\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nCopper is a premium material with a high price tag. Usually, they are reserved for the kitchen where the style and patina of a copper sink is on full display, but you can use a copper farmhouse laundry sink. Like stainless steel, choose a copper sink with a low gauge, so it isn\u0026rsquo;t prone to denting.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eIn addition to developing a patina that can increase the sinks\u0026rsquo; value over time, copper is even more antimicrobial than stainless steel. This is a welcome feature if you want to avoid mildew developing after leaving clothing in the sink.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFireclay \u0026amp; Ceramic\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nA ceramic laundry sink is made of clay that\u0026rsquo;s fired at high temperatures with a glaze to harden the material. The glaze makes the surface exceptionally smooth, so it\u0026rsquo;s scratch-resistant and stain-resistant. Fireclay laundry sinks include porcelain and vitreous china varieties.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eCeramic laundry sinks look like enameled cast-iron sinks. However, they are typically more affordable because they are prone to cracking. Without a cast-iron core, a ceramic sink can crack all the way through, making it unrepairable.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAcrylic Plastic\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nAcrylic, also known as solid surface, is a type of plastic often used for laundry sinks because it\u0026rsquo;s easy to mold, durable, lightweight, and affordable. However, solid surface sinks don\u0026rsquo;t have the lifespan of other materials and don\u0026rsquo;t handle heat very well. They also scratch and stain easily.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eFrequently Asked Questions About Laundry Sinks\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat size is a laundry sink?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nLaundry sinks vary in size. At the smallest, they are around 6\u0026rdquo; deep and 20\u0026rdquo; wide. The biggest laundry sinks are over 24\u0026rdquo; deep and up 42\u0026rdquo; wide. The size you choose depends on how you use it and how much room you have.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDo you really need a laundry sink?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nYou don\u0026rsquo;t need a laundry sink unless you handwash clothing frequently. In fact, many homes don\u0026rsquo;t have laundry sinks, since most people use washing machines and dryers. Many design experts recommend forgoing the sink in your laundry room in favor of counterspace for folding laundry.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow do you clean your laundry sink?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nFill the sink with warm water and a few capfuls of peroxide or ammonia. These chemicals kill any mildew causing bacteria. Then drain the sink, wash with soap, and rinse.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eHow much does it cost to install a laundry sink?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nIf all you need to do is connect the plumbing, then you can easily install a laundry sink yourself. If you hire a professional, basic installations cost around $200, with the plumbing already set up and without complications. If the plumbing needs modifications, like for heavy duty pipes to drain dirt and mud, it can cost between $500 and $1,000. When you consider the cost of installing a utility sink faucet, add another $150 to $200 to the bill.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eCan you wash your hands in a utility sink?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nYes. Utility sinks are ideal for garages so you can wash grease and grime from cars, housework, and hobbies off your hands before you enter your house. Depending on where you install your utility sink, you may need a soap holder if your counter space doesn\u0026rsquo;t have enough room to store a soap dispenser near your sink. Also consider adding a high-quality sink faucet for superior handwashing abilities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat do you call a sink in the laundry room?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nLaundry sinks have several names \u0026ndash; utility sink, utility tub, mud room sink, mud sink, vintage tub, mudroom sink, garage sinks, and more. Regardless of how they\u0026rsquo;re named, they all generally have the same purpose \u0026ndash; to clean things you wouldn\u0026rsquo;t use a kitchen sink for.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat utility sink styles do you have to choose from?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e\nFor laundry rooms, the laundry tubs typically come in traditional or modern styles to match a specific interior design. However, if you\u0026rsquo;re getting a utility sink for your garage, it\u0026rsquo;s typically a freestanding utility tub with a very basic industrial style \u0026ndash; four legs supporting a rectangular tub with an industrial utility faucet.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003ch3\u003eHave Dirty Laundry? Get a Laundry Sink\u0026nbsp;\u003c/h3\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eChoosing the right laundry sink is all about finding the best material, the right size, and the best mounting style for your laundry room. Once you have your sink, you can turn your attention to other plumbing fixtures, like pull-out faucets and other plumbing supplies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eAt Vevano Home, we have a wide selection of the best utility sinks, from simple stainless-steel utility sinks to enameled cast-iron freestanding utility sinks. We can help you select the right sink for your home. Consult with our remote interior design experts by calling 855.483.2629 or email us your questions at \u003ca href=\"mailto:design@vevano.com\"\u003e\u003cu\u003edesign@vevano.com\u003c/u\u003e\u003c/a\u003e.\u0026nbsp;\u003c/p\u003e\n"},"elementId":"","additionalClasses":"","margins":"0px","padding":"0px","border":"none","borderRadius":"0px","visibilityBreakpoint":{"value":"","label":"Always The fireclay material is both elegant and extremely durable, the smooth surface is resistant to scratches and stains.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eThe Manor House Collection\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eAdd vintage flair with any sink from the Manor House Collection. The rich, uniform grain is scratch resistant for heavy-duty use, whether it's a kitchen sink or a prep, bar, laundry or commercial sink. Light scratches, which occur with everyday use, naturally blend into the finish of this durable sink with time. Deeper scratches are repairable with an Elkay stainless steel restoration kit.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWho is Elkay?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eElkay has been a trusted name in stainless steel since 1920. We are proud to be America's No. 1 selling kitchen sink company. In addition, we offer prep, bar, bath and laundry sinks.
